pr_title: Presto on Spark small refactorings and bug fixes

timeline.message:
Ensure only single SparkContext exist per jvm

More than one active spark context per jvm is not supported

Fix PrestoSparkOutputOperator

In case of 0 columns row the output can be empty. Empty output
does not contain byte array.

Ensure only single SparkContext exist per jvm

More than one active spark context per jvm is not supported

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe this should be a static field instead?
timeline.author: shixuan-fan

replies.bodyText: It is not going to be called on production anyway. It's pretty much a hack just to make TPCH / System connectors happy. Hopefully we will refactor presto-main a little bit and decouple it from the node management.
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: I'm not particularly sure if we should have two separate constructors, but I don't have strong opinion on this.
timeline.author: shixuan-fan

replies.bodyText: Just wanted to keep the main non testing call site clean. Having an extra optional might be confusing.
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
Register system catalog for Presto on Spark

It is generally useful to provide the same set of system table as convetional
Presto does. But the main reson here is that AbstractTestQueries expects this
catalog to exist.

Improve PrestoSparkQueryRunner

Make it ready to run AbstractTestQueries:

- Setup TestingAccessControlManager in PrestoSparkQueryRunner
- Register testing functions in PrestoSparkQueryRunner
- Register testing session properties for PrestoSparkQueryRunner
Run presto-spark-base tests in a separate travis job

Ensure only single SparkContext exist per jvm

More than one active spark context per jvm is not supported

Ensure only single SparkContext exist per jvm

More than one active spark context per jvm is not supported
